Apex Material Technologies, LLC. is a metal-based manufacturer, processor, and marketer of performance chemicals, serving the metal finishing, printed circuit board, catalyst, and related industries. Apex Material Technologies, LLC. also produces High Purity Grade Copper Oxide, Cupric Chloride, Copper Sulfate and Copper Nitrate.



Apex Material Technologies, LLC's. Joliet Facility has been a chemical processing plant since 1972. The 1.6 acre Facility is currently receiving non-ignitable, non-reactive metal bearing inorganic materials to be processed on-site. Ammonia (anhydrous) is used in the processes. All raw materials are purchased and stored in tanks specifically designed for their unique requirements.  All storage tanks are diked and/or in uniquely designed storage areas to prevent any loss of materials.



There are two indoor container storage areas; one in the East Warehouse and one in the West Warehouse, where raw materials are stored prior to processing.

There are also Tank Storage areas for storing bulk liquids. There are twelve tanks in Tank Storage Area #1 and one in Tank Storage Area #2.



The Plant Manager is responsible for day-to-day operations at the Facility. The Plant Manager's duties include: managing personnel requirements, scheduling and coordinating plant production and material flow, developing job safety practices, ensuring day-to-day compliance with all applicable regulations and permits, maintaining all required documents and records, and implementing and coordinating Contingency Plan procedures.



The Technical Manager position includes developing and implementing management systems and programs to support operations at the site.  Duties include developing policies and procedures, conducting compliance audits and inspections, preparing and presenting training programs, consulting to the company's sales personnel, consult and support management projects on design, construction and modifications in reference to environmental requiremen

ts, and ensuring environmental compliance at the Facility.



Apex Material Technologies, LLC. Joliet Facility conducts routine inspections of the facility with emphasis placed on maintaining operational effectiveness of monitoring, safety, security, and structural equipment.  These inspections are conducted in order to protect against the release of raw materials which may threaten human health and/or the environment. 



The Joliet Facility complies with the OSHA Process Safety Management Program for Ammonia (anhydrous).



The Joliet Facility does not accept raw materials streams containing organics, ignitable, or reactive characteristics. Containers of incompatible raw materials are not stored within the same warehouse. Incompatible raw materials are not transferred to tanks within the same secondary containment structure.



The facility no longer receives shipments of liquid chlorine in bulk.



Most releases of materials in process would be expected to be minor (less than one drum) and could be cleaned up with dry absorbent materials; a neutralizing agent; and/or manually collected by pumping liquids from the floor trench or picking up solids. The Facility Contingency Plan will be implemented whenever there is a release greater than one gallon.



Classroom and on-the-job training is provided to employees involved in all processing activities as part of the Safety and Health Program. Initial training for new employees consists of 24 hours duration to enable employees to perform their duties in a safe and healthful manner.  All employees receive a minimum of eight hours of refresher training annually thereafter.

Emergency response training includes all of the following components:



-  Hazard Recognition 

-  Method of Minimizing risks

-  Proper Use of Control and Personnel Protective Equipment

-  Proper Operating Procedures at Incident Scenes

-  Coordination with Other Employees

-  Response to Overexposure or Injury
